response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents accurately. The fixed-policy agents always propose a split where they get the majority of the blankets, and they always accept any proposal, regardless of the split. The flexible-policy agent, on the other hand, does not consistently propose a split where they get the majority of the blankets, and they do not always accept any proposal.

Principle: Always propose a split where you get the majority of the blankets, and always accept any proposal, regardless of the split.
